subject: Bump openstacksdk to 0.12.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-03-20 18:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-03-20 18:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.openstack.org/644962 and https://review.openstack.org/644961 submitted to test this working.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-20 18:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

this is a test for now'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-03-20 18:30:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What's plan B? Come up with a backport on the old version?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 04:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> What's plan B? Come up with a backport on the old version?

I *think* the plan B would be modify the gate scripts so that it install ansible in a venv and can install the version require by ansible 2.6"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 05:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This impacts multiple vendors in ways we said we wouldn't do so we need to look harder.

Well isn't this a fun little problem :D

My thoughts on this are going to wander all over the place and frankly they're not at all well formed so I expect they'll be hard to follow ... sorry.

My first thought is openstack/requirements is about ensuring that OpenStack components are co-installable and at least one[1] of them is pinned to 2.4.  I'm pretty sure that this is about updating the ansible used buy the gate but we'd like very much for that to be compatible with any ansible needed by OpenStack projects?

[2] Says that 2.5.9 is the current 2.5 release and is security supported .. Oh I see when 2.8 is released 2.5 goes EOL and I assume given ~4 month release cycle 2.8.0 will be ready Real Soon Now.

Given our new(ish) Extended Maintenance cycle queens could and probably will be a thing in 4 months so will we need to move to 2.7 when that happens?

IIUC the 0.12.0 requirement comes from [3] so that'd mean that os_quota[4] isn't and can't work in an ansible installed with u-c.

I think we need to understand most? of that ... Assuming that we do and we all agree we need something like this

The biggest issue is that 0.12.0 is the first rocky[4] release and introduces the following effective minimum bumps:

 [tony@thor openstacksdk]$ git diff -U0 0.11.0..0.12.0 -- *requirements.txt 
 diff --git a/requirements.txt b/requirements.txt
 index f131da00..7a4f9fed 100644
 --- a/requirements.txt
 +++ b/requirements.txt
 @@ -5 +5 @@ pbr!=2.1.0,>=2.0.0 # Apache-2.0
 -PyYAML>=3.10 # MIT
 +PyYAML>=3.12 # MIT
 @@ -10,2 +10,2 @@ six>=1.10.0 # MIT
 -os-service-types>=1.1.0 # Apache-2.0
 -keystoneauth1>=3.3.0 # Apache-2.0
 +os-service-types>=1.2.0 # Apache-2.0
 +keystoneauth1>=3.4.0 # Apache-2.0
 @@ -17 +17 @@ jmespath>=0.9.0 # MIT
 -ipaddress>=1.0.16;python_version<'3.3' # PSF
 +ipaddress>=1.0.17;python_version<'3.3' # PSF

The only one of which that isn't covered by the queens u-c is os-service-types which implies a bump to >= 1.2.0

 [tony@thor os-service-types]$ git diff -U0 1.1.0..1.2.0 -- *requirements.txt 
 diff --git a/test-requirements.txt b/test-requirements.txt
 index e3f6dd2..a94411c 100644
 --- a/test-requirements.txt
 +++ b/test-requirements.txt
 @@ -8,3 +8,3 @@ coverage!=4.4,>=4.0 # Apache-2.0
 -python-subunit>=0.0.18 # Apache-2.0/BSD
 -sphinx>=1.6.2 # BSD
 -oslotest>=1.10.0 # Apache-2.0
 +python-subunit>=1.0.0 # Apache-2.0/BSD
 +sphinx!=1.6.6,>=1.6.2 # BSD
 +oslotest>=3.2.0 # Apache-2.0
 @@ -12,3 +12,3 @@ testscenarios>=0.4 # Apache-2.0/BSD
 -requests-mock>=1.1 # Apache-2.0
 -openstackdocstheme>=1.16.0 # Apache-2.0
 -keystoneauth1>=3.1.0 # Apache-2.0
 +requests-mock>=1.1.0 # Apache-2.0
 +openstackdocstheme>=1.18.1 # Apache-2.0
 +keystoneauth1>=3.3.0 # Apache-2.0
 @@ -16 +16 @@ keystoneauth1>=3.1.0 # Apache-2.0
 -reno!=2.3.1,>=1.8.0 # Apache-2.0
 +reno>=2.5.0 # Apache-2.0

which are test-only changes and all of which seem to be from queens anyway?

Coming back to the effective bumps.  We're getting better with lower-constraints at covering and testing them but we know we're not there for rocky (and probably still not for stein)

So if we were to do this we would be asking vendors to bump the shipped version.

 Debian: seems to be 1.1.0 [6]
 RDO: is 1.1.0 [7]
 Gentoo: seems to have dropped queens? [8]
 suse:  I don't know how to map [9] to released things :/ sorry
 ubuntu: is 1.1.0 [10]

I haven't looked at the 'enterprise' releases like suse cloud or RedHat OpenStack platform but I'd expect them to be similar to the community releases 

So that's the long way round of saying not without more information[11]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/stable/queens/scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh#L25
[2] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/release_and_maintenance.html
[3] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/stable-2.6/lib/ansible/module_utils/openstack.py#L111
[4] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/stable-2.6/lib/ansible/modules/cloud/openstack/os_quota.py#L109
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/rocky/openstacksdk.yaml#L9-L12
[6] https://salsa.debian.org/openstack-team/libs/python-os-service-types/commit/f130e94dbed08d6dc9185dae00b109e86b4b8bce
[7] https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-queens/current/python-os-service-types-1.1.0-0.20180211211248.f130e94.el7.centos.src.rpm
[8] https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/dev-python/os-service-types
[9] https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/Cloud:OpenStack:Upstream:Master/python-os-service-types
[10] https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-cloud-archive/+archive/ubuntu/queens-staging/+index?batch=75&memo=150&start=150
[11] I think this is the most verbose review comment I've ever made"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-27 21:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Monty, is this still needed?'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-02 18:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandoning, asked if was still needed, no response, reopen if still needed'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-02 18:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ya, gentoo dropped queens, preping for stein (with rocky out)'}]

commit_message:
Bump openstacksdk to 0.12.0

ansible modules, which are used by some of OpenStack for things,
require a newer openstacksdk for ansible versions newer than 2.5.
2.5 is about to be EOL, so openstack jobs are winding up needing
to shift to ansible 2.6 at least.

This may crash and burn terribly. Or it might just be fine.

Change-Id: I0779abd9fef68e8fa902c177f0776b635ed708c7

Currently, this only allows 'IPv4' or 'IPv6', but one can imagine a user

Neutron.

Change-Id: I70ce1f43d32aad01b174437d03c984a5b608b161
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore case in security group rule --ethertype

Currently, this only allows 'IPv4' or 'IPv6', but one can imagine a user
frequently typing e.g. 'ipv6' and getting frustrated. Allow any case,
while still keeping correct case for the choices and the value sent to
Neutron.

Change-Id: I70ce1f43d32aad01b174437d03c984a5b608b161

I'm not sure that this is correct.

Could be wrong, but my understanding was that ip_from_q was only intended for the dynamic inventory script to generate container IPs from a corresponding name in cidr_networks.

If your provider network's net_name is not 'lbaas', it looks like you should override 'octavia_provider_network_name' and 'octavia_provider_network' will look it up.

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L322-L339"}, {'account_id': 26647, 'date': '2018-10-23 20:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I'm not sure that this is correct.
 > 
 > Could be wrong, but my understanding was that ip_from_q was only
 > intended for the dynamic inventory script to generate container IPs
 > from a corresponding name in cidr_networks.
 > 
 > If your provider network's net_name is not 'lbaas', it looks like
 > you should override 'octavia_provider_network_name' and
 > 'octavia_provider_network' will look it up.
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L322-L339


You are right, ip_from_q is used by dynamic inventory scripts and (!) what it creates is container_networks["lbass_address"] in host vars.
octavia playbook reference to that container network here:  
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L338
As you see it used net_name, not ip_from_q field to construct "lbass_address". And that what i'm trying to fix.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-10-24 18:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-25 08:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-10-20 15:12:11.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 17:34:40.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
'}, {'created': '2018-10-25 11:42:47.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
'}]
commit_message:
octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c

commit_message:
Fix misuse of assertFalse

The first argument of assertFalse should not be False,
otherwise the assertFalse will be useless and always pass.

Change-Id: I3b6303ff3d2fb9b5fee1a8d73af4e5819fadde76

commit_message:
Validate server status in volume api tests

Only 3 test in the volume section requires a working vm
for a proper detach. The vm aliveness tested over ssh,
which helps in avoiding the missed acpi events issues.

The get_server_ip is closely related to the validation resources,
created in the base class, so moving it there.

The ServerUnreachable exception used by this method,
so moving it to the lib_exc.

The ssh output also helps in to see was the vm
dead before a detach failed.

Change-Id: I2f19067c538482565df4e0d4b6025f025f1922f6

commit_message:
Data remains in staging area if 'file' store is not enabled

When operator has not enabled 'file' store and using other stores like ceph,
swift etc. the uploading to staging area works as we explicitly
build 'file' store during this operation, while cleaning up we directly
use 'glance_store.delete_from_backend' which only works if 'file'
store is enabled.

Modified '_DeleteFromFS' task and _unstage call which will use os
module to unlink the file present in staging area explicitly to
delete the data from staging area.

Conflicts:
       glance/async/flows/api_image_import.py
       glance/tests/unit/async_/flows/test_web_download.py

NOTE: async_ module was not available in queens so renamed
the module name to async.

Closes-Bug: #1803498
Change-Id: If0b3b0af9300301291758c67267890e0959ebb3c
(cherry picked from commit c92724608512d42b56152d199cc0fea049e4d4a7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 15:23:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add placement as required project to functional py36 and 37

The functional tests are configured to install placement from git
so that they test with placement-from-master. In the py27 and py35
functional tests, placement is a part of required-projects, which
means that depends-on to a particular patch of placement can work
via tox-siblings[1].

This patch adds the same functionality for py36 and py37 functional
tests, which currently run only in the experimental queue.

commit_message:
Add placement as required project to functional py36 and 37

The functional tests are configured to install placement from git
so that they test with placement-from-master. In the py27 and py35
functional tests, placement is a part of required-projects, which
means that depends-on to a particular patch of placement can work
via tox-siblings[1].

This patch adds the same functionality for py36 and py37 functional
tests, which currently run only in the experimental queue.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#installation-of-sibling-requirements

Change-Id: Ia40aba6d3036fea2bc62fdf76e8e221b552f1cdc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 09:36:58.000000000', 'message': "Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
(cherry picked from commit aa58fbcacfdc14bb2e8d5a4ff1ef7a47fe9268d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
(cherry picked from commit aa58fbcacfdc14bb2e8d5a4ff1ef7a47fe9268d0)

more spare amphora than the spare_amphora_pool_size setting.

commit_message:
Configure pacemaker nova-consoleauth agent to check rabbitmq port

When rabbitmq-server is configured with ssl=only nova-console auth will
connect to the 5671 tcp port (or any other configured by ssl_port
configuration option), res_nova_consoleauth will fail its check
marking this resource as down and stopping nova-consoleauth process.

This patch explicitly sets the amqp port in the agent's configuration
and updating it when the port changes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/573039
Change-Id: Ibdd6bb448ac66786c62052a1bf38a45e886aae97
Closes-Bug: 1753432

[{'created': '2019-03-25 14:58:03.000000000', 'message': 'Delete shadow users when domain is deleted

Without this change, when an admin tries to delete an LDAP-backed
domain, it fails due to the foreign key relationship in the users table.
Previously, we were assuming that LDAP users existed solely in the LDAP
directory, but this is not true with shadow users. This patch fixes the
logic to delete the shadow users upon domain deletion.

Change-Id: I12a08001e3aa08e4db9438cae425ad1a0a8070f7
Closes-bug: #1801873
'}, {'created': '2019-03-25 19:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Delete shadow users when domain is deleted

Without this change, when an admin tries to delete an LDAP-backed
domain, it fails due to the foreign key relationship in the users table.
Previously, we were assuming that LDAP users existed solely in the LDAP
directory, but this is not true with shadow users. This patch fixes the
logic to delete the shadow users upon domain deletion.

Change-Id: I12a08001e3aa08e4db9438cae425ad1a0a8070f7

commit_message:
Delete shadow users when domain is deleted

Without this change, when an admin tries to delete an LDAP-backed
domain, it fails due to the foreign key relationship in the users table.
Previously, we were assuming that LDAP users existed solely in the LDAP
directory, but this is not true with shadow users. This patch fixes the
logic to delete the shadow users upon domain deletion.

Change-Id: I12a08001e3aa08e4db9438cae425ad1a0a8070f7
Closes-bug: #1801873

commit_message:
WiP: Revert "Fix ifup failures on member interfaces with IPv6"

This reverts commit 23a411413fbad6e96ed6b3c3ec3876cba3d8f4fd. This is
now only used for testing the issue on Kuryr-Kubernetes gate, please do
not merge.

Change-Id: Ib790c541ec5bfa07f226c2e32bf207db461a65d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 20:39:15.000000000', 'message': 'Move creation of rpcapi.ComputeAPI object from __init__

Currently, we create a compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object during
NovaProxyRequestHandler.__init__ in order to make calls to nova-compute
for console token authorizations (port validation). This is problematic
in the event that we receive a TCP RST as it results in constructing a
ComputeAPI object only to throw it away and a large number of TCP RST
sent can cause excessive resource consumption.

This moves the creation of the ComputeAPI object from __init__ to the
handle_websocket method, which is only called if the handshake gets
past the socket read stage, and avoids creation of ComputeAPI objects
when we receive TCP RST messages.

Closes-Bug: #1816727

Change-Id: I3fe5540ea460fb32767b5e681295fdaf89ce17c5
'}, {'created': '2019-03-21 18:41:40.000000000', 'message': 'Move creation of rpcapi.ComputeAPI object from __init__

ComputeAPI object only to throw it away and a large number of TCP RST
sent can cause excessive resource consumption.

This moves the creation of the ComputeAPI object from __init__ to the
handle_websocket method, which is only called if the handshake gets
past the socket read stage, and avoids creation of ComputeAPI objects
when we receive TCP RST messages.

Closes-Bug: #1816727

Change-Id: I3fe5540ea460fb32767b5e681295fdaf89ce17c5

ComputeAPI object only to throw it away and a large number of TCP RST
sent can cause excessive resource consumption.

This moves the creation of the ComputeAPI object from __init__ to the
handle_websocket method, which is only called if the handshake gets
past the socket read stage, and avoids creation of ComputeAPI objects
when we receive TCP RST messages.

Closes-Bug: #1816727

Change-Id: I3fe5540ea460fb32767b5e681295fdaf89ce17c5
'}, {'created': '2019-03-27 21:51:45.000000000', 'message': 'Move create of ComputeAPI object in websocketproxy

Currently, we create a compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object during
NovaProxyRequestHandler.__init__ in order to make calls to nova-compute
for console token authorizations (port validation). This is problematic
in the event that we receive a TCP RST as it results in constructing a
ComputeAPI object only to throw it away and a large number of TCP RST
sent can cause excessive resource consumption.

This moves the creation of the ComputeAPI object from __init__ to being
lazily instantiated upon first use by access of a property, thus
avoiding creation of ComputeAPI objects when we receive TCP RST
messages.

Closes-Bug: #1816727

Change-Id: I3fe5540ea460fb32767b5e681295fdaf89ce17c5
'}]
commit_message:
Move create of ComputeAPI object in websocketproxy

Currently, we create a compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object during
NovaProxyRequestHandler.__init__ in order to make calls to nova-compute
for console token authorizations (port validation). This is problematic
in the event that we receive a TCP RST as it results in constructing a
ComputeAPI object only to throw it away and a large number of TCP RST
sent can cause excessive resource consumption.

This moves the creation of the ComputeAPI object from __init__ to being
lazily instantiated upon first use by access of a property, thus
avoiding creation of ComputeAPI objects when we receive TCP RST
messages.

Closes-Bug: #1816727

Change-Id: I3fe5540ea460fb32767b5e681295fdaf89ce17c5

commit_message:
Fix comments in environments/net-* network configuration envs

The environment files that select which network configuration files
to use for a deployment have an incorrect comment. The comment
mentions port configurations above the network configuration
templates. This patch corrects the comments.

Change-Id: Idb5c09f7c803a89d388e4458b032bbebd4b2590b
Closes-bug: 1822693

commit_message:
Update the default metrics.yml file

Work items:

- Added "user_id" to default groupby attributes
- Replaced "flavor" metadata by "flavor_name" for instances (it is the
  default attribute name in gnocchi)
- Replaced network.incoming/outgoing.bytes by
  network.incoming/outgoing.bytes.rate. The previous metrics were cumulative,
  whereas the new ones are rates.

Change-Id: I55271bfbdd5a3457bea249dbefefd93a78ee057e
(cherry picked from commit 4cfc06c4b61110f9ec9b90693c8591ff81618fe3)

commit_message:
Update the default policy rule for /v1/storage/dataframes

For now, this endpoint is unprotected, allowing any authenticated user to
access it. This hardens the access control.

Change-Id: Id35e162a213449527b871c01056779c29239edfa

Bug in openstacksdk [1] causes connections to leak when calling neutron
APIs.  To workaround this problem until the bug is fixed in
openstacksdk, we can explicitly close the connection session.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005306

Closes-Bug: #1809691

commit_message:
Explicitly close connection session

Bug in openstacksdk [1] causes connections to leak when calling neutron
APIs.  To workaround this problem until the bug is fixed in
openstacksdk, we can explicitly close the connection session.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005306

Change-Id: Ia5dc292f3a5800282e07ea3ec3da3adc3b00a690
Closes-Bug: #1809691

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I28b9b536b3f22d6398c7e5be6bd205da73c07bd5
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I28b9b536b3f22d6398c7e5be6bd205da73c07bd5

[{'created': '2018-11-19 17:30:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add the noop management interface to the manual-management hardware type

The current fake management interface fails when setting boot device to
disk, which makes manual-management unusable with boot_option:local.

commit_message:
Add the noop management interface to the manual-management hardware type

The current fake management interface fails when setting boot device to
disk, which makes manual-management unusable with boot_option:local.
As always with the noop management, we expect an operator to correctly
configure the boot order (e.g. to PXE with fall back to disk).

Change-Id: I551efa1a23dd3d6b33401610f298f436e8317539

plays per task, this patch does the same for the upgrade_steps_playbook

more legible, removing all those annoying 'skipping' tasks for steps that
didn't match the step variable value.

commit_message:
WIP: Split upgrade_steps_playbook into different plays.

In the same way deploy_steps_playbook is split into different
plays per task, this patch does the same for the upgrade_steps_playbook
, this way we obtain more control on the tasks we want to execute by
using a specific tag or set of tags (upgrade_stepX) and at the same
time improve the readability and understanding on ehat the playbok does.
Also, I4d864f374d6f840585fafef2c7678e55c154898e allows us to run a single
play with all the tasks for a specific step, instead of running them all
passing a step value each time. This will make the upgrades faster and
more legible, removing all those annoying 'skipping' tasks for steps that
didn't match the step variable value.

Change-Id: I29477ebefd256e34eb689cb3b72a539ff83233a3
Depends-On: I4d864f374d6f840585fafef2c7678e55c154898e
(cherry picked from commit 841f686fb1931b3cefd215d1af4fc088d1d1ac07)

commit_message:
IBM XIV: add method update_migrated_volume for xiv

Post migrate, rename the volume to original volume's name on storage.
If the volume and original volume exist in the same storage, using
_name_id to record the relationship.

Change-Id: Ie990eda0fe408fc1ef71af906b8d5af8168c46f4
Closes-bug: #1774905

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 10:17:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add action to force resync of images in all pools on local endpoint

There exist failure scenarios where abrupt shutdown and/or
interruptions to communication may lead to a split-brain situation
where the RBD Mirroring process in both Ceph clusters claim to be
the primary.

In such a situation the operator must decide which cluster has the
most recent data and should be elected primary by using the
``demote`` and ``promote`` (optionally with force parameter)
actions.

After making this decision the secondary cluster must be resynced
to track the promoted master, this is done by running the
``resync-pools`` action on the non-master cluster.

Change-Id: I4f57c9202ed4d055066286f808369ec0ddddb7ea
'}, {'created': '2019-04-01 10:22:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add action to force resync of images in all pools on local endpoint

There exist failure scenarios where abrupt shutdown and/or
interruptions to communication may lead to a split-brain situation
where the RBD Mirroring process in both Ceph clusters claim to be
the primary.

In such a situation the operator must decide which cluster has the
most recent data and should be elected primary by using the
``demote`` and ``promote`` (optionally with force parameter)
actions.

After making this decision the secondary cluster must be resynced
to track the promoted master, this is done by running the
``resync-pools`` action on the non-master cluster.

Change-Id: I4f57c9202ed4d055066286f808369ec0ddddb7ea
'}, {'created': '2019-04-01 10:42:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add action to force resync of images in all pools on local endpoint

commit_message:
Add action to force resync of images in all pools on local endpoint

There exist failure scenarios where abrupt shutdown and/or
interruptions to communication may lead to a split-brain situation
where the RBD Mirroring process in both Ceph clusters claim to be
the primary.

In such a situation the operator must decide which cluster has the
most recent data and should be elected primary by using the
``demote`` and ``promote`` (optionally with force parameter)
actions.

After making this decision the secondary cluster must be resynced
to track the promoted master, this is done by running the
``resync-pools`` action on the non-master cluster.

Change-Id: I4f57c9202ed4d055066286f808369ec0ddddb7ea

Centralize pool mirror eligibility decision making

Pool mirror eligibility is currently done in generator expressions
repeated where needed.

Centralize this in one function.

commit_message:
ceph-client: device_class support

ceph-client will apply the desired device_class to the
desired nodes. Thus user can create crush rule and pool
for their specific hardware and needs

Story: ceph-device-class-support
Change-Id: I4d951ca211f7a1f28c3900f38d1238ce07b7aa4e
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
Signed-off-by: kranthikirang <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

commit_message:
Use non-broken commit for NoVNC

NoVNC shipped a change that broke the entire Nova integration,
this patch reverts to the change *just* before it in order to
be able to ship a working NoVNC.

Change-Id: Icde731c89c66669ac5df6cf524c608f6008a8668
Related-Bug: #1822676

commit_message:
Drop py35 tests

Target python runtime for Stein is py36 [1]. So, I will drop py35
tests.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I3b6db2463864635246ccb4a551898861b890a818
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 323eb9fd4fb773a63ed7ac32fd8821e57203475b)

commit_message:
The PTG is no longer OpenStack-specific

Remove mentions to "OpenStack PTG" as we invite much more
teams to the PTG than just OpenStack teams.

Change-Id: I85b0125b669c0ed970463efd98574480de1469a7

commit_message:
Share assisted vol snapshots test between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges assisted volume snapshots functional tests.

Change-Id: Idf2dd3c875a89b65865a8e3621429dfb7d62af15

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 15:07:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove vbmc log file in devstack

Because vbmcd is now managed by systemd, making vbmcd logging
to its standard streams makes all logs in one place.

Change-Id: I1f7e5665816bd3045aa1b4760a28e610ebbb5766
'}]
commit_message:
Remove vbmc log file in devstack

Because vbmcd is now managed by systemd, making vbmcd logging
to its standard streams makes all logs in one place.

Change-Id: I1f7e5665816bd3045aa1b4760a28e610ebbb5766

subject: virt: use compute.arch constants and validate architectures

commit_message:
virt: use compute.arch constants and validate architectures

Where we have hardcoded architectures, use the compute.arch
constants. Where we get architectures from external systems
or users, validate them against the list of acceptable names.

The Xen hypervisor is reporting 'i686' architecture with the
unusual name 'x86_32' so must be converted to use the normal
name. Upon upgrade the existing data in the compute nodes
table will be upgraded by the periodic refresh of compute
node information.

On the other side, the ImagePropertiesFilter will canonicalize
the architecture it fetches from image metadata, so that
'x86_32' gets remapped to 'i686' during comparison.

Closes-bug: #1348624
Change-Id: I1adfb0a2258a628004aaa28c1ac04c4cf3d3eea6

Work items:

- Added "user_id" to default groupby attributes
- Replaced "flavor" metadata by "flavor_name" for instances (it is the
  default attribute name in gnocchi)
- Replaced network.incoming/outgoing.bytes by
  network.incoming/outgoing.bytes.rate. The previous metrics were cumulative,
  whereas the new ones are rates.

Change-Id: I55271bfbdd5a3457bea249dbefefd93a78ee057e

commit_message:
Update the default metrics.yml file

Work items:

- Added "user_id" to default groupby attributes
- Replaced "flavor" metadata by "flavor_name" for instances (it is the
  default attribute name in gnocchi)
- Replaced network.incoming/outgoing.bytes by
  network.incoming/outgoing.bytes.rate. The previous metrics were cumulative,
  whereas the new ones are rates.

Change-Id: I55271bfbdd5a3457bea249dbefefd93a78ee057e

subject: Fix a broken link in a release note
messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-01 10:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure that this is going to work the way you want. When an HTTP client makes a request the #anchor portion is not sent to the server, so it is not available to be used in the pattern matching used for a redirect. Look at this:

    cdent-a01:~/src/placement(master) $ curl -v 'http://burningchrome.com/#foobar'
    *   Trying 139.162.196.171...
    * TCP_NODELAY set
    * Connected to burningchrome.com (139.162.196.171) port 80 (#0)
    > GET / HTTP/1.1
    > Host: burningchrome.com
    > User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
    > Accept: */*"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-04-02 01:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-02 08:45:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Yeah, this is a good workaround. Thanks.

We'll need to backport it since the docs are versioned."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-02 12:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

commit_message:
Update python3 version info

In Train, we will use python 3.6 and 3.7 for python3 runtime
in our gate jobs [1]. This commit drops python 3.5 info
and adds python 3.6 and 3.7 info.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I8f024505ed9b37c9f2b480f49b5000d75da42cc0

commit_message:
Do not add dimensions to init_config

monasca_setup adds dimensions passed as arguments to the
`init_config.keystone_config` section of http_check.yaml. These should
be set only for instances.

Change-Id: Iccdefbaaaf5cc3ad87848f1c51ae2a2a055e309e
Story: 2005296
Task: 30246

subject: Remove redundant policies from v3cloudsample
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-25 19:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-25 19:45:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-03-26 17:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm pretty sure the failing tests here can be removed [0].

If I understand correctly, they are failing because the policies are not being overridden to use only the defaults. As a result, the deprecated rule:admin_required rule is getting OR'd with the new defaults and since the user executing those tests has the `admin` role on a domain, they're allowed to access any domain.

I think we're covering that case with tests in the previous patch [1].

[0] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_protection.py#n1048
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643937/7/keystone/tests/unit/protection/v3/test_groups.py@435"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-26 20:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-26 20:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-27 16:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-03-27 16:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Remove redundant policies from v3cloudsample

By incorporating system and domain scope and default roles into
keystone's default policies for domains, we've effectively made these
policies obsolete. This change also removes the redundant group
management tests from the v3cloudsample tests.

Change-Id: I4e3b19f9cc025a472fb27a33955856c2cd17fd1d
Partial-Bug: #1806762

commit_message:
Update Zuul Jobs

- Move default python to py3 for devstack jobs
- Remove old (and non working) experimental jobs
- Move legacy devstack jobs to devstack-tempest based jobs

- Update vagrant plugins nodeset

Change-Id: Ida65852dec370a53641cb6428d50b0a2ac81f387
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

Update the default policy rule for /v1/storage/dataframes

For now, this endpoint is unprotected, allowing any authenticated user to
access it. This hardens the access control.

commit_message:
Make system admin policies consistent for grants

This commit adjust the create and revoke grant policies to be
consistent with other system admin policy check strings by not using
the rule:admin_required check string and by including system_scope:all
in the rule itself.

Subsequent patches will:

 - implement domain reader and member support
 - implement domain admin support
 - introduce test coverage for project users and the grants API
 - remove redundant policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Related-Bug: 1805368
Related-Bug: 1750669
Related-Bug: 1806762

Change-Id: Idcbe16f643332d80af716074cf3ea22525d465a9
(cherry picked from commit ef838a3a3f575562b1fc84623c3a8491d4f2e2f4)

commit_message:
Add tap-as-a-service-tempest-plugin repo

* To move tap-as-a-service tempest plugin currently hosted in
  the tap-as-a-service main repo.

* neutron-tempest-plugin is not appropriate right now because
  tap-as-a-service is not a part of neutron yet.

Related-Bug: #1819893
Change-Id: Idee6bd0c32776594c33b9d65ced3c8dce7ff69fd

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ifce6c6a6c6680ed0cc054b4cd3e09ff204824057

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I4ce29ba14741c6b6075a734d550f991b9194bf93

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 02:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'i18n: Extract strings from template files

Previously babel-django.cfg was configured to look up
template files only in $TOP_DIR/templates.
Templates dierctories in deeper directories
are not covered and all template files are located there.
As a result, Django templates cannot be translated.

Change-Id: I8c662ee2358afbf120464fdffeb72f8515e5a49c
(cherry picked from commit 3bb4264dab3737589ede1ceac22bab8015b0f364)
'}]
commit_message:
i18n: Extract strings from template files

Previously babel-django.cfg was configured to look up
template files only in $TOP_DIR/templates.
Templates dierctories in deeper directories
are not covered and all template files are located there.
As a result, Django templates cannot be translated.

Change-Id: I8c662ee2358afbf120464fdffeb72f8515e5a49c
(cherry picked from commit 3bb4264dab3737589ede1ceac22bab8015b0f364)

commit_message:
Fix import errors on Nagios check file

After changing the charm runtime to Python 3, some imports are failing
on check_swift_storage.py. This can be fixed by explicitly imporgin the
modules inside the package, instead of just importing the package.

Change-Id: I746071042b669a1725744d4e32ea733eb40b309a
Closes-bug: #1822334

[{'created': '2019-04-01 12:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)

commit_message:
Clear the non-pristine blocked status

We need to clear the blocked status "non-pristine device detected ..."
when there is no non-pristine device anymore

Change-Id: I2f31eb9c08be186c08554122c2a160bbcbf2c389
Signed-off-by: dongdong tao <dongdong.tao@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810508

commit_message:
Ceph: fix overriding ceph monitor hosts value

all other charts that related with ceph have the logic
to override the ceph monitor hosts.
but storage class chart only has no logic to override the value.
to use external ceph, it must be able to set manually the ceph host.

Change-Id: I212f6bdae8046d08f50f01b178200df77375f14d
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2016-08-05 16:41:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

I think this needs some documentation for why this change is taking place.

I do not know for sure if the ability to find hosts is intermittently failing or otherwise. But if the error rate has increased then there is something we are missing to evaluate.

Please provide a spec for where will this partial read be used, like which part of Nova driver or if there's some other opensource code that will use it.

I currently am short of b/w to evaluate what happens at the boot process when nova is reading partial size, I am hoping that the partial read isn't confusing the driver to determine the host on which the image needs to be built. If that's the case, the whole cross project effort needs much more work."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-04-02 11:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-19 11:03:22.000000000', 'message': 'Allow random read in RBD driver (get method)

Currently RBD driver does not make use of offset or chunk parameters.

This patch tries to provide random access read to the driver using
parameters offset and chunk in the following way:
offset: the Byte count (position) from the start of the image
chunk_size: the total number of bytes we want to be readusing parameters
offset and chunk.

So get method returns an iterator that will return blocks of
READ_CHUNKSIZE maximum size until it reaches chunk_size bytes or the end
of the image.

Adds unittests for RBD get method since they were missing.

Change-Id: Id01ec61644a822be1876819c46381be49c271eab

So get method returns an iterator that will return blocks of

'}, {'created': '2015-02-19 12:26:25.000000000', 'message': 'Allow random read in RBD driver (get method)

Currently RBD driver does not make use of offset or chunk parameters.

This patch tries to provide random access read to the driver using
parameters offset and chunk in the following way:
offset: the Byte count (position) from the start of the image
chunk_size: the total number of bytes we want to be readusing parameters
offset and chunk.

So get method returns an iterator that will return blocks of
READ_CHUNKSIZE maximum size until it reaches chunk_size bytes or the end
of the image.

commit_message:
Allow partial read in RBD driver

This patch allows users to perform a partial read of an image by using the
length and offset parameters in the following way:

offset: the byte count (position) from the start of the image
length: the total number of bytes to be read

So get method returns an iterator that will return blocks of
READ_CHUNKSIZE size until it reaches length bytes or the end
of the image.

Closes-Bug: 1538527

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Gotliv <sgotliv@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id01ec61644a822be1876819c46381be49c271eab

commit_message:
Add domain scope support for group policies

This commit adds support for the domain scope type for the group API
policies. It defines appropriate policies for the reader, member, and
admin role and adds tests for each case.

Change-Id: Iaff3c0e45423ef427ef1458250c402c44be4b1d6
Closes-bug: #1808859
Partial-Bug: #968696
(cherry picked from commit be452fee80fabe252b2dae3be76c1d46fdd857e4)

commit_message:
Creates aditional nrpe checks which parse warning/error messages

When Ceph is in a warning state for reason1 and in the meantime
new reason2 appears, operator is not alerted and also cannot mute
alarms selectively (as described in bug #1735579)
This patch alllows to specify a dictionary of 'name':'regex' where
'name' will become ceph-$name check in nrpe and $regex will be
searched for in warning/error messages. It is specified via
charm nagios_additional_checks parameter.
There is also nagios_additional_checks_critical parameter which
specifies if those checks are reported as warning or error.

Change-Id: I73a7c15db88793bb78841d8395535c97ca2af872
Partial-Bug: 1735579

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 21:00:49.000000000', 'message': 'Hacking N362: Don't abbrev/alias privsep import

As noted in [1]:

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

This commit introduces hacking rule N362 to enforce the above.

[1] Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

Change-Id: I95ac43203a74aa71710035d75d0bf54821acee94
'}]
commit_message:
Hacking N362: Don't abbrev/alias privsep import

As noted in [1]:

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

This commit introduces hacking rule N362 to enforce the above.

[1] Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

Change-Id: I95ac43203a74aa71710035d75d0bf54821acee94

commit_message:
make lower-constraints env use lower-constraints

- The lower constraints job did not actully use the
  constraints from lower-constraints.txt because
  the install_command in the base tox env included
  the upper-constraints from the requirements repo.
- This change fixes the install command in the
  lower-constraints tox env.
- This change modifies the lower-constraints.txt
  to allow nova to install.
- This change sorts the lower-constraitns.txt and
  add missing packages that were installed but
  not listed.

Closes-Bug: #1822575
Change-Id: I96f48c49cc700d4e40c8eb77cb2c8d845b8ff075

commit_message:
Fix installing tempest plugins

When running stack.sh locally on stable branches
with tempest enabled and TEMPEST_PLUGINS set,
devstack will try to fetch master branch of requirements
and that fails if branch is not tracked.

Change-Id: Ia1ae6869a8fede2af5cd7c875e0946b6a75eb518
Closes-Bug: #1820051
(cherry picked from commit bcd8a50cc688ee39b4b998efe959e35c4c5b1408)

commit_message:
Fix capabilities passed as string in agent prepare

The value of capabilities can be either a string or a dict.
There is a function to parse its value and provide a correct
output as expected and it should always be used when reading
node capabilities.

Change-Id: I789fffd5f67eddbe5058581f13d75320ca712897
Story: 2005280
Task: 30133

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-26 10:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-03-26 10:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-26 18:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nSeeing issues with killing placement in Kayobe upgrade CI job.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-26 18:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-03-28 11:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-29 11:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1 Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-29 11:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-04-02 09:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 10:13:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362
(cherry picked from commit 192dcd1e1b9baf7f3177a694c2b1ce8bd62d9159)
'}, {'created': '2019-03-26 18:33:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

This patch merges in https://review.openstack.org/647858 which was
applied after the original patch in the rocky branch to avoid sending
SIGHUP to placement-api, which does not like it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362
(cherry picked from commit 192dcd1e1b9baf7f3177a694c2b1ce8bd62d9159)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

This patch merges in https://review.openstack.org/647858 which was
applied after the original patch in the rocky branch to avoid sending
SIGHUP to placement-api, which does not like it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362
(cherry picked from commit 192dcd1e1b9baf7f3177a694c2b1ce8bd62d9159)

commit_message:
Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

This patch merges in https://review.openstack.org/647858 which was
applied after the original patch in the rocky branch to avoid sending
SIGHUP to placement-api, which does not like it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362
(cherry picked from commit 192dcd1e1b9baf7f3177a694c2b1ce8bd62d9159)

Similarly to the interfaces, the volume detach can
fail if the vm is not ready for processing the acpi
signals. The ssh daemon allow to login around the same

Change-Id: Ic43ae3b76467a5cbeb6c2fe128435d64ab7743b5

commit_message:
Add missing validation for the compute/positive

Similarly to the interfaces, the volume detach can
fail if the vm is not ready for processing the acpi
signals. The ssh daemon allow to login around the same
time so it will helps to avoid detach failures.

commit_message:
Drop py35 tests

Target python runtime for Stein is py36 [1]. So, I will drop py35
tests.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I3b6db2463864635246ccb4a551898861b890a818
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

> This is REST API change. At least microversion should be bumped,
 > but I'm not sure that this change is needed (not state-related
 > fields in states). You can simple use node-show via cli or any set
 > of fields via API client.

When i'm provisioning a baremetal we are checking the state of the node with the command "ironic node-show-states". If the node is failed and goes to maintain mode user has to use node-show with the fields , if we can use show this maintenance and maintenance_reason information i think it is better. commit_message:
Now displays maintenance and maintenance_reason

When we are provisioning a bare-metal node, we are checking the state
of the node with the command ``ironic node-show-states``. If the node
fails and goes to maintenance mode, user has to use ironic node-show
with the mentioned fields.

Change-Id: I0f84da23ea3f4594f175629be574ac493cefdead
Closes-Bug: #1663129

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18893, 'date': '2017-03-30 15:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think it's worth documenting this in the ironic docs, even if it's also in the nova docs. On the other hand, I'm not sure it belongs in "getting started" or "configure nova". I think the obvious place is "System architecture", but maybe "Troubleshooting" would make sense.'}, {'account_id': 15750, 'date': '2017-03-31 01:16:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey guys, can we get a consensus on where this should go please? I don't want to keep pushing revisions just to get another comment about moving it again.

I also agree with Miles, the Nova docs are the wrong place. As a relative newbie that is the *last* place I would look for information on how to configure Ironic and information on its workings.

FWIW I'm happy where it is, for now. I still think the docs need restructuring but that's a bigger job. If you don't want the change then fine, I'll abandon it for now and move on to something else."}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2017-03-31 09:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The reason why I think about nova docs, because not only ironic virt driver works as you described it would be good to document that in Nova.

Also I agree with Miles, we may add "Nova virt driver" to "System Architecture" https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/doc/source/dev/architecture.rst

I agree with this, it should be in ironic docs. But I don't think Nova integration should come iunder the section for associated projects that one may optionally utilize for additional functionality, which is where it is now.  

+1 that it should be in system architecture. Either we need to make a page for system architecture, or this should be moved to a different location on this current page. Optionally we could also put it at the beginning of the "configuring compute to use bare metal service". I am not sure if that is the ideal place for it because this is a blurb describing system architecture moreso than how to configure compute, but I'm not sure "ideal" is a realistic target with docs.'}, {'account_id': 19593, 'date': '2017-03-31 22:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah, if you could add a test that would be great, thanks'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-03-29 06:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-03-29 13:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Seems leagcy does have the bug as well, but different code path:/'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-29 14:30:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Yep, in legacy it looks like we just store the new environment at the beginning of a stack update. In the past we've done various things (merging parameters, incrementally updating templates) to try to improve consistency after updates fail, but apparently we never did that for merging the resource registry.

All of these tricks can ultimately never be perfect until we store the template that each resource was created with, which is one of the selling points of convergence.

It would be possible to fix the specific bug uncovered this test (if something from the old registry is not present in the new registry, copy it over). It's not possible to solve bugs in the legacy where the resource registry entry _changes_ (there's no way to know which one to keep - and in fact we may need both for different resources).

I think I'd probably be OK with skipping the new test on legacy. Most people will benefit from the convergence fix, which is a complete fix. Maybe we can add another task to the story for improving the legacy path as much as we can and leave that one open."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-04-01 08:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-04-01 13:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-04-02 05:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2019-02-26 06:33:48.000000000', 'message': "Ignore listing resources if resource_type not in registry

With convergence we load resources from db for a stack
when listing its resources. However, it's possible for a
FAILED stack to have resources in db that does not have
any mapping in the resource registry. Let's ignore those
too.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
"}, {'created': '2019-03-26 16:18:04.000000000', 'message': "Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
"}, {'created': '2019-03-29 06:21:51.000000000', 'message': "Load existing resources using correct environment

commit_message:
Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688

[{'created': '2018-09-29 01:11:23.000000000', 'message': 'Validate attributes schema

We always check that a properties schema is valid at the time that it is
created. Do the same for the attributes schema. This will catch programming
errors in the writing of Resource plugins.

Story: #2003915
'}]
commit_message:
Validate attributes schema

We always check that a properties schema is valid at the time that it is
created. Do the same for the attributes schema. This will catch programming
errors in the writing of Resource plugins.

Change-Id: I8119aec30b83f1f9e711013a60a828ae4a8337c7
Story: #2003915

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 09:38:49.000000000', 'message': 'fix api context load failure for cyborg-api runs by uwsgi

when deployable POST request[0] is made with admin user, it always returns
a 403 forbidden code. This patch fixes the bug.
The root cause is that "return app.app_factory(CONF)" in init_application()
will only load app:api_v1(see in [1]) and miss others filters:authtoken etc.

[0]: curl -g -i -X POST http://192.168.23.76/accelerator/v1/deployables
[1]: /etc/cyborg/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I1498705271fe6de6fc42db9b73221d9794c36b2b
'}]
commit_message:
fix api context load failure for cyborg-api runs by uwsgi

when deployable POST request[0] is made with admin user, it always returns
a 403 forbidden code. This patch fixes the bug.
The root cause is that "return app.app_factory(CONF)" in init_application()
will only load app:api_v1(see in [1]) and miss others filters:authtoken etc.

[0]: curl -g -i -X POST http://192.168.23.76/accelerator/v1/deployables
[1]: /etc/cyborg/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I1498705271fe6de6fc42db9b73221d9794c36b2b

[{'account_id': 29879, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/637811/2 : FAILURE in 1h 40m 47s'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-02-21 03:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is the wrong approach IMO. I think we should be checking and setting default_prefixlen to a sane default rather than blocking the pool creation if min_prefixlen is smaller than the prefixes in the pool. I believe an adjustment to default_prefixlen is what you're really after. min_prefixlen was designed to be aribitrary in that isn't necessarily bounded by the available prefixes in the subnet pool. Prefixes can be added (and eventually removed, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635907/). The better fix in my opinion is to set default_prefixlen to a more user-friendly default."}, {'account_id': 29879, 'date': '2019-02-22 12:18:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

> This is the wrong approach IMO. I think we should be checking and
 > setting default_prefixlen to a sane default rather than blocking
 > the pool creation if min_prefixlen is smaller than the prefixes in
 > the pool. I believe an adjustment to default_prefixlen is what
 > you're really after. min_prefixlen was designed to be aribitrary in
 > that isn't necessarily bounded by the available prefixes in the
 > subnet pool. Prefixes can be added (and eventually removed, see
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635907/). The better fix in my
 > opinion is to set default_prefixlen to a more user-friendly
 > default.

Thanks for your comments.

I want to confirm with you that after the deletion of prifixes in the future, prefixes will be used as extensions of subnetpool.It can be deleted and added. But will the logic of allocating subnets change when subnetpool is used to create subnets?

If unchanged, prefixlen can be specified when creating subnet using subnetpool. If prefixlen is not specified,
Subnet is allocated using the default_prefixlen of subnet_pool as request prefixlen.
The prefixlen of the request is compared with min_prefixlen of subnet_pool before allocating the subnet.
If the prefixlen requested is less than min_prefixlen, the subnet creation fails. I think this is also the meaning of min_prefixlen's existence.If min_prefixlen was designed to be aribitrary, there is no sense of existence. What do you think?

Thank you for reminding me about user-friendliness. Users can specify by --min-prefixlen and --default-prefixlen.But if the subnet pool does not satisfy the user-specified subnet, I think the error alarm is also necessary.

After prefixes are incorporated as extensions of subnetpool,
Adding or deleting prefixes also requires timely updates of min_prefixlen and default_prefixlen IMO.

Please also point out the mistakes. I am looking forward to your reply."}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:56:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nothing will change in the logic of allocating subnets. The ongoing to work on subnetpool_prefix_ops simply presents a cleaner API for managing the prefix list of the subnetpool.

min_prefixlen is meant to be a quota mechanism. It is meant to enforce a maximum theoretical subnet size that can be allocated from the pool. The prefix list determines what is actually available to allocated, within the bounds of min_prefixlen. For those reasons, I would prefer to see min_prefixlen left alone.

It is my opinion that default_prefixlen should be set to a reasonable default if not specified when a subnet is created. It makes sense for that default to be derived from the prefix list in some way so that subnets can actually be allocated using that default. However, once the subnetpool has been created we should leave min_prefixlen, default_prefixlen, and max_prefixlen alone unless the user specifically changes them.'}, {'account_id': 29879, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29879, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > default. However, once the subnetpool has been created we should

 > default. However, once the subnetpool has been created we should

Thank you very much for your detailed analysis.
I have got the meaning of min_prefixlen as a quoto mechanism.

I have modified the default default_prefixlen of subnetpools to make
that subnets can actually be allocated using that default. 

Please also point out the mistakes. Thanks a lot.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-25 10:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Modify default default_prefixlen of subnetpools

Using a subnetpool whose default_prefixlen isn't specified to
create a subnet,to make it can be allocated,
the default_prefixlen is set to be the bigger one
between the min_prefixlen and the min prefixlen of pool_prefixes
when creating subnetpools by default.

Change-Id: I16324d49e4e80719a0a8333674101aef24b702ab
Closes-bug: #1816502

[{'created': '2019-03-29 09:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception type in test_boot_reschedule_fill_provider_mapping_raises

After Iecbee518444bd282ce5f6fd019db41a322f76a83 merged the
test_boot_reschedule_fill_provider_mapping_raises does not simulate a
possible scenario as ConsumerAllocationRetrievalFailed cannot be
raised from _fill_provider_mapping any more.

The fault this functional test reporduces still exists just with
different exception types. So this patch changes the exception type
to a valid one that is still raised by _fill_provider_mapping.

Change-Id: I79cf44aafccb1bc6b13a3109c5a98215811bd04d
Related-Bug: #1819460
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception type in test_boot_reschedule_fill_provider_mapping_raises

After Iecbee518444bd282ce5f6fd019db41a322f76a83 merged the
test_boot_reschedule_fill_provider_mapping_raises does not simulate a
possible scenario as ConsumerAllocationRetrievalFailed cannot be
raised from _fill_provider_mapping any more.

The fault this functional test reporduces still exists just with
different exception types. So this patch changes the exception type
to a valid one that is still raised by _fill_provider_mapping.

Change-Id: I79cf44aafccb1bc6b13a3109c5a98215811bd04d
Related-Bug: #1819460

commit_message:
Stop nova-specs announcing in #openstack-placement

a) placement specs are no longer being kept in nova-specs
b) the people in #openstack-placement who care abourt nova-specs
   are usually in #openstack-nova too (where nova-specs continue
   to be announced)

Change-Id: I447c210affa013a539956dcc4a81e038c5a8c64c

commit_message:
Adds systemd detection result caching in Quobyte driver

Instead of rechecking for systemd multiple times check only
once and cache the result in the Quobyte driver.

Furthermore this fixes a range of minor nits like adding
comments, generalizing the libvirt privsep umount and
clarifying variable names in related tests, as noted
in previous change I53f3a062ce419d1142d7dd3103fab565bb105e05 .

Last but not least this adds unit tests for newly added
functions in privsep.libvirt, using a fixture from
change I53b8cca99729bcae6246c79f342f87f55a4ea95c .

Related-bug: #1756823

Change-Id: Iba30c49f108af9055de1b1a5c7b1a8406d66cf1a
