Also need a more informative commit message.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

I think documentation regarding service clients can be added in a separate patch set because it's somewhat out of scope here. But holding off on +2 till I get some clarity on whether we agree in QA that Patrole can add service clients. I myself don't see much of an issue with it, though I would prefer using tempest.lib as it guarantees a stable library."}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-24 01:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

I think all plugins or extended services (fwaas in this case) RBAC test will go on plugin side like Tempest does. 

if i remember correctly we discussed about-
1. make patrole framework stable and release its stable version
2. plugins start consuming the patrole framework to implement their rbac tests'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-24 01:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-2

According to: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-stein-ptg and https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/stable-interfaces-from-tempest-plugins

1) Service clients like fwaas should be separated into their own repo
2) Plugins service clients can be used in other Tempest plugins to avoid  duplicate code/interface (this is what the PluginRbacClasses do: they consume neutron-tempest-plugin service clients, but work should be done to make neutron-tempest-plugin stable).

However:

3) Patrole should not test neutron-fwaas in tree. Patrole tests for neutron-fwaas should go into a neutron-fwaas-plugin project or something similar.

I will add documentation to clarify that Patrole can test Neutron extensions but not plugins in tree and that might require renaming the classes (.*PluginRbacTest => .*ExtensionRbacTest) to make it clearer.

Having to support all the service clients for fwaas and tests for fwaas here is out of scope for Patrole. I think clarifying documentation can be added to Patrole documentation to make it clear that it will only test "main" OpenStack projects, like Tempest. This is to:

1) Avoid having to support our own service clients for fwaas which are not a stable interface
2) Having to support additional projects in Patrole that are not within the "core" OpenStack project umbrella (nova, neutron, keystone, glance, cinder)... swift doesn't count because it doesn't have RBAC via oslo.policy.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-24 02:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

> According to: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-stein-ptg and
 > https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/stable-interfaces-from-tempest-plugins
 > 
 > 1) Service clients like fwaas should be separated into their own
 > repo
 > 2) Plugins service clients can be used in other Tempest plugins to
 > avoid  duplicate code/interface (this is what the PluginRbacClasses
 > do: they consume neutron-tempest-plugin service clients, but work
 > should be done to make neutron-tempest-plugin stable).
 > 
 > However:
 > 
 > 3) Patrole should not test neutron-fwaas in tree. Patrole tests for
 > neutron-fwaas should go into a neutron-fwaas-plugin project or
 > something similar.
 > 
 > I will add documentation to clarify that Patrole can test Neutron
 > extensions but not plugins in tree and that might require renaming
 > the classes (.*PluginRbacTest => .*ExtensionRbacTest) to make it
 > clearer.
 > 
 > Having to support all the service clients for fwaas and tests for
 > fwaas here is out of scope for Patrole. I think clarifying
 > documentation can be added to Patrole documentation to make it
 > clear that it will only test "main" OpenStack projects, like
 > Tempest. This is to:
 > 
 > 1) Avoid having to support our own service clients for fwaas which
 > are not a stable interface
 > 2) Having to support additional projects in Patrole that are not
 > within the "core" OpenStack project umbrella (nova, neutron,
 > keystone, glance, cinder)... swift doesn't count because it doesn't
 > have RBAC via oslo.policy.

+1 for documenting it.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2018-10-24 02:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

Thanks, sounds very reasonable. So I will abandon this patch, but work should be done. Will try to find a way how to add this test to neutron-FWaaS project.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2018-10-24 02:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-03-16 03:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Due to migrating FWaaS tempest tests to neutron-tempest-plugin repo: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643662/'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-03-16 03:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-03-26 19:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: -Code-Review

> Restored
 > 
 > Due to migrating FWaaS tempest tests to neutron-tempest-plugin
 > repo: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643662/

Thanks, I will keep an eye on that.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-03-29 16:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Workflow-1'}]

commit_message:
Add missing FWaaS tests

Missing policies:
* `insert_rule` for "Insert rule into a firewall policy" action [0]
* `remove_rule` for "Remove rule from firewall policy" action [1]

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#id370

commit_message:
Switch job definitions to use new "tempest_plugin" variable

This new variable was recently added to zuul in [1] to build
TEMPEST_PLUGINS list by combining plugin names with devstack
base path.

In old stable branches we still have to use old version with
TEMPEST_PLUGINS devstack option configured directly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639374/

Change-Id: I6bc2a3e752234d20890d64ceaefa0714cd05038f
Closes-Bug: #1822453

commit_message:
Don't install numpy packages

numpy is a python requirement of the websockify package (it appears
there was some disucssion over *removing* this in [1], but did not
happen).  Possibly these packages were installed a long time ago
before wheel support as it was taking a long time to build.  But we
have wheels today, and later versions than the distro provides are
being dragged in anyway.  Remove all distro installs.

[1] https://github.com/novnc/websockify/pull/163

Change-Id: I322dd9e1a07d8ce03c26cf3fcccebd6e21282fe4

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I58da29d7a17ab237ae97dbcd790beb95ba8b4518

commit_message:
Switch to openstackdocstheme

oslosphinx has been unmaintained for multiple cycles and we shouldn't
be using it anymore.

Some minor changes to the specs were necessary because the newer
sphinx introduced some warnings that were making the doc build fail.

Change-Id: I4d053e39a8859854b7f56bcf654071b7d950297b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-17 19:11:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix proxy extension for neutron RBAC

Neutron is looking for 'tenant_id' in the response from the proxy plugin.
This patch makes sure the 'project_id' returned from octavia is copied over
to the 'tenant_id' in the response to neutron.

Change-Id: I840b5e2e8a95a4b3e166db9f9aa44590441aa7b6
"}, {'created': '2018-03-19 16:27:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix proxy extension for neutron RBAC

Neutron is looking for 'tenant_id' in the response from the proxy plugin.
This patch makes sure the 'project_id' returned from octavia is copied over
to the 'tenant_id' in the response to neutron.
This patch also adapts Octavia's 403 Forbidden errors to neutron's 404 [1].
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/ \
    policy.html#request-authorization

Change-Id: I840b5e2e8a95a4b3e166db9f9aa44590441aa7b6

Neutron is looking for 'tenant_id' in the response from the proxy plugin.
This patch makes sure the 'project_id' returned from octavia is copied over
to the 'tenant_id' in the response to neutron or assigns the one from the
context.

This patch also adapts Octavia's 403 Forbidden errors to neutron's 404 [1].
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/ \
    policy.html#request-authorization

Neutron is also returning a 404 instead of a status "DELETED". This
adjusts that.

    policy.html#request-authorization

commit_message:
Fix proxy extension for neutron RBAC

Neutron is looking for 'tenant_id' in the response from the proxy plugin.
This patch makes sure the 'project_id' returned from octavia is copied over
to the 'tenant_id' in the response to neutron or assigns the one from the
context.

This patch also adapts Octavia's 403 Forbidden errors to neutron's 404 [1].
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/ \
    policy.html#request-authorization

Neutron is also returning a 404 instead of a status "DELETED". This
adjusts that.

Neutron/tempest will ask for the tenant_id field - replace this with
project_id.

Handle 403 Forbidden

Fixes bug to not pass on empty string to Octavia

Story: 2002602
Task: 22220

Change-Id: I840b5e2e8a95a4b3e166db9f9aa44590441aa7b6

commit_message:
Drop horizon_keystone_host variable

The horizon_keystone_host is only used as interpolation
for OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, which we define manually. So
horizon_keystone_hosts server no purpose.

Change-Id: I693bdb30e3d812592f023c00fbbbd62f069320bf

commit_message:
[Functional tests] Change way how conntrack entries are checked

In netlink_lib functional tests module there are listed conntrack
entries and those entries are assert to some expected list.
It may happen that sometimes some additional entries from other
tests will also be in the list and that cause failures of
netlink_lib tests.

So this patch changes way how those assertions are done. For now
it will check if each of expected entries is in entries list and
in case of delete entries tests, it will also check if any of
deleted entries isn't actually in list.

Change-Id: I30c18f141a8356b060902e6493ba0657b21619ad
Closes-Bug: #1817295

commit_message:
This blueprint proposes adding XClarity boot driver for Lenovo
XClarity Administrator managed Systemx Flex/X6/M5 series servers.
Servers, nodes are used interchangeably that denotes Flex/X6/M5 series servers.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1613198
Implements: blueprint [RFE] Xclarity boot driver

bug/1613198

Change-Id: Ibc7b118fb207313df150a0e0e61f9b1d667999e6

commit_message:
Elaborate on the business value of goal champions

Recent threads on the openstack-discuss mailing list [0] suggest
revisiting the idea of formatting the help-wanted list to represent
the value each initiative provides a sponsor. This feedback was given
to the Technical Committee during the Vancouver summit in 2018.

This is an attempt at describing the value sponsoring a goal champion
has on a business.

This commit also amends the document introduction to include intended
audiences and which parts of the document they might find most useful.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/002252.html

Change-Id: Idfa593a12550f8cdc3a5f617b8271a30e1d7a3b9

[{'created': '2019-03-21 11:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Appoint Divya K Konoor as PowerVMStackers PTL

PowerVMStackers did not have any PTL candidate in the required candidacy
timeframe and as a result has triggered the leaderless team process.

Divya K Konoor did submit a candidacy[1] but too late, and she only had
commits too recent to be a valid candidate. The PTL for the Stein cycle
confirmed[2] that she would make a great PTL.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643003
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003770.html

Change-Id: I9f3c7a38e3eb83f9a67169204d71a206d2f3d132
'}]
commit_message:
Appoint Divya K Konoor as PowerVMStackers PTL

PowerVMStackers did not have any PTL candidate in the required candidacy
timeframe and as a result has triggered the leaderless team process.

Divya K Konoor did submit a candidacy[1] but too late, and she only had
commits too recent to be a valid candidate. The PTL for the Stein cycle
confirmed[2] that she would make a great PTL.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643003
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003770.html

Change-Id: I9f3c7a38e3eb83f9a67169204d71a206d2f3d132

commit_message:
Appoint Trinh Nguyen as Telemetry PTL

Telemetry did not have any PTL candidate in the required candidacy
timeframe and as a result has triggered the leaderless team process.

Trinh Nguyen volunteered to take the role, while Lingxian Kong and
Rong Zhu promised resources to help:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003897.html

Change-Id: I71615aa714edcd0b821e46f153ad6481cd0c4c20

commit_message:
Allow using introspection data in condition's 'value' field

Conditions ``value`` supports fetching data from introspection, it's
using python string formatting notation.

Change-Id: I2e87abd6e84cc31e72bf79ce957899b20ff50014
Closes-Bug: #1579727

commit_message:
Appoint Weng Hao as Zaqar PTL

Zaqar did not have any PTL candidate in the required candidacy
timeframe and as a result has triggered the leaderless team process.

The PTL for the Stein cycle, Weng Hao, sent an email explaining that
he missed the deadline and would like to continue as Zaqar PTL:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003760.html

Change-Id: I0aa268c9cf9b5a43f9b77c218a1658aa29b781b3

(with both hats)

The three leaderless teams have their former PTLs replaced by placeholders. Follow-up patches can add the appointments along with an "appointed" list including the train cycle (to match how they were annotated for stein). Note that this removes IRC nicks from some returning PTLs and also changes some of their names. These changes reflect what is currently in their respective OSF member profiles, so it would be good for them to update those at the same time they post any corrective patches to the projects.yaml file. These are also the same names and IRC nicks (or lack thereof) which appeared on https://governance.openstack.org/election/ leading up to and throughout the course of the election period.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-20 01:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Let's not block this patch on waiting for people to update their foundation identity. If we have the information, we should insert it by hand."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-03-21 13:07:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As I probably failed to suggest clearly enough in my original comment, the names and IRC nicks (or lack thereof) reflect what was present in the candidates' respective OSF member profiles at the time of the election and are also reflected in the recorded election results. Rather than asking election officials to correct them based on hearsay and review comments, let's please have anyone who wants to update their PTL details just submit a follow-up governance patch so we have a clear record.

Of course, also correcting your OSF member profile to match helps make sure you won't need to submit corrective patches after future elections."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-21 13:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Making IronicException to subclass from ironic_lib

present in ironic_lib.

[{'created': '2019-04-01 12:51:39.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I94762b42716b6ccb42c82de77e00a36d4132601b
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I94762b42716b6ccb42c82de77e00a36d4132601b

Add xfs-check-ftype role

This patch adds the xfs-check-ftype role created from:
- validations/check-ftype.yaml

Change-Id: Iea70b76e12cf4660c90fefe3c2025c732be8d851
Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 20944, 'date': '2019-03-20 19:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-03-20 19:43:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 19:42:50.000000000', 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

If an instance is launched with a volume creation,
it will show /dev/vda when it should be /dev/sda.

Removing the vol_device_name and not forcing device
name by horizon fixes the situation.

VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09

Removing the vol_device_name and not forcing device

VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To

If an instance is launched with a volume creation,
it will show /dev/vda when it should be /dev/sda.

Removing the vol_device_name and not forcing device
name by horizon fixes the situation.

VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda

"}, {'created': '2019-03-28 01:46:26.000000000', 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
"}]
commit_message:
Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09

[{'created': '2019-03-24 20:46:57.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),

Change-Id: Id61da652e79dca0f43e79626c078675a3efbd69a

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Id61da652e79dca0f43e79626c078675a3efbd69a
